channel.title: Admin Starter?

item.title: Admin Starter?
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

Array arguments to the addItem() like:

public boolean addItem(int[], int) { ... } ... if(String.equals("s")) { addItem(new int[] { 1, 2, 3, 4 }); }

You could always add a 2d array method argument to handle both the IDs and amounts, I guess.

Read full topic

item.title: Admin Starter?
item.dc:creator: @Syme Syme
item.description:
@Syme wrote:

You post this on player handler right?

Read full topic

item.title: Admin Starter?
item.dc:creator: @Project_Evolution Project Evolution
item.description:
@Project_Evolution wrote:

Yea, I personally beleive a single addItem() with an integer array as its itemid parameter would be a really good idea especially in certain situations where lots of items will be spawned, also leaving the original addItem() method for only small amounts of item spawns.

A good use of whats called method-overloading.

Read full topic

item.title: Admin Starter?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Project Evolution:

Yes, but he said array arguments in its parameters. Since thunderflea didnt understand what he meant I posted it. It would require having to slightly edit the method, but it wouldnt be too big a deal.

May actually prove very useful in the future, I may add a secondary spawn method for this. Saves me writing out the array and loop each time.

Read full topic

item.title: Admin Starter?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

No he said array

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) { if (starter == 0 || platerRights > 1) { int[] starterItems = {item1, item2, item3, item4}; for (int i = 0; i < starterItems.length; i++) { addItem(i, 20000); } } }

Like that.

item.title: Admin Starter?
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

He means making additem do this

addItem(item1, amount1, item2, amount2, item3, amount3); (Individual items)
or

addItem(item, item, item, item, item, amount); (Stackables)

item.title: Admin Starter?
item.dc:creator: @thunderflea thunderflea
item.description:
@thunderflea wrote:

how do i make it so admins can get the starter more than once? this is my command i have so far

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) { if (starter == 0) || (platerRights > 1) { addItem(995, 50000000); addItem(392, 15000); addItem(554, 20000); addItem(555, 20000); addItem(565, 20000); addItem(556, 20000); addItem(557, 20000); addItem(560, 20000); addItem(561, 20000); addItem(562, 20000); addItem(563, 20000); addItem(566, 20000); addItem(558, 20000); sendMessage("IronScape Starter Package"); starter = 1; savemoreinfo(); savechar();
i get errors compiling.
here are the errors.

illegal start of expression
if (starter == 0) || (playerRights > 1) {
                      ^

Read full topic
